Ubuntu 8.10 (''Intrepid Ibex''), to be released on [[2008-10-30]],<ref name="intrepid_release">{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+milestone/ubuntu-8.10|title=Milestone ubuntu-8.10 for Ubuntu due 2008-10-30|accessdate=2008-04-28}}</ref> will be Canonical's ninth release of Ubuntu.<ref name="warty_release" /> It will be supported until April 2010. Ubuntu 8.10 has several planned new features including a new default theme,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-art/2008-January/004855.html | title=Ubuntu theme update postponed | accessdate=2008-03-26}}</ref> improvements to mobile computing and desktop scalability, increased flexibility for Internet connectivity, a [[Graphical User Interface|GUI]] driven [[Live USB]] creator (possibly [[Live USB system creator]]), a guest account,<ref>
+
Ubuntu 8.10 (''Intrepid Ibex''), to be released on [[2008-10-30]],<ref name="intrepid_release">{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+milestone/ubuntu-8.10|title=Milestone ubuntu-8.10 for Ubuntu due 2008-10-30|accessdate=2008-04-28}}</ref> will be Canonical's ninth release of Ubuntu.<ref name="warty_release" /> It will be supported until April 2010. Ubuntu 8.10 has several planned new features including a new default theme,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-art/2008-January/004855.html | title=Ubuntu theme update postponed | accessdate=2008-03-26}}</ref> improvements to mobile computing and desktop scalability, increased flexibility for Internet connectivity, a [[Graphical User Interface|GUI]] driven [[Live USB]] creator (possibly [[Ubuntu USB desktop image creator]]), a guest account,<ref>
{{cite web |url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/Specs/Intrepid/GuestAccount | title=Guest account specification | accessdate=2008-08-19}}
{{cite web |url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/Specs/Intrepid/GuestAccount | title=Guest account specification | accessdate=2008-08-19}}
</ref> an encrypted 'private' directory in each user's home directory<ref>
</ref> an encrypted 'private' directory in each user's home directory<ref>
